text:
:til: you can use `dump` on a `DataType` , and it will not display the layout of the datatype, but give a generalized picture of the layout of instances of that datatype. Very useful! e.g.
```julia> dump(UnitRange{UInt8})
UnitRange{UInt8} <: AbstractUnitRange{UInt8}
  start::UInt8
  stop::UInt8```
Also, not documented :/

text: don’t know what you mean by <https://docs.julialang.org/en/v1/base/io-network/#Base.dump|not documented>

text: I mean that you can call dump(MyStruct) and it will give you the layout of instances of MyStruct, not of MyStruct itself
